Dear Jimt
I m enclosing several copies of the convention registration.
I suggest that you have one of your secretaries break this down as
to totcl number of registrants, number of states, number of foreign
countries represented, etc., in order that you may have some con¬
vention statistics to present in the next Hews-Letter.
I m unfortunately in no position to offer my resumes as to
what went on in the meetings! However, I do have tapes of the talks
given by Humphrey, Walker, and lyler, and also of the Thursday
afternoon Siegel session arranged by Leonard Marks. I am sending
these to you under separate cover in order that you may refer to them
in writing the report of the meetings and also so that you msy consider
them for offering on the KALB tape network if you so desire.
I shall also dig up a few copies of the text of Walker*s talk
so that you may refer to them.
in regard to the new stationery which you referred to on page 2
of your November lb letter to ;.raveon, may I suggest that you so
arrange the officers' names so as to include the secretary up with
the president, vice president, and treasurer? The implication of
the stationery we now use is that the secretary is not a full member
of the official family which is not the case. So treat yourself to
the acclaim you deswerve and see that your position is put up st the
top as you deserve!
